info.name: EOCS-T902
info.description: # ðŸš€ Get started here This template guides you through CRUD operations (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), variables, and tests. ## ðŸ”– **How to use this template** #### **Step 1: Send requests** RESTful APIs allow you to perform CRUD operations using the POST, GET, PUT, and DELETE HTTP methods. This collection contains each of these request types. Open each request and click "Send" to see what happens. #### **Step 2: View responses** Observe the response tab for status code (200 OK), response time, and size. #### **Step 3: Send new Body data** Update or add new data in "Body" in the POST request. Typically, Body data is also used in PUT and PATCH requests. ``` { "name": "Add your name in the body" } ``` #### **Step 4: Update the variable** Variables enable you to store and reuse values in Postman. We have created a variable called `base_url` with the sample request [https://postman-api-learner.glitch.me](https://postman-api-learner.glitch.me). Replace it with your API endpoint to customize this collection. #### **Step 5: Add tests in the "Tests" tab** Tests help you confirm that your API is working as expected. You can write test scripts in JavaScript and view the output in the "Test Results" tab. ## ðŸ’ª Pro tips - Use folders to group related requests and organize the collection. - Add more scripts in "Tests" to verify if the API works as expected and execute flows. ## â„¹ï¸ Resources [Building requests](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/requests/) [Authorizing requests](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/authorization/) [Using variables](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/variables/) [Managing environments](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/managing-environments/) [Writing scripts](https://learning.postman.com/docs/writing-scripts/intro-to-scripts/)

request.description: Login eITI of any system You need to write the system name you would like to test in the following area. - Click on EOCS-T902 folder on left. - Click Variables tab. - Enter any system (for ex. master, titan, vega, etc.) in Current value field. Click on the picture to see it bigger. After sending request succesfully, check if the 'access_token' from response exist as in the following picture. After opening EOCS-T902 directory and variables tab, look for UeDEI_access_token variable, if it does not exist ,add it and paste the copied access token value from first request in Current value field. For every request after eITI Authenticate request, you select Bearer token as Authorization type and write the token field {{eITI_access_token}} as in the above picture. _**_ If you get 403 code after sending this request, it means the user you are using has no Default Authorization Profile. You should assign one.

exec: //This test can be still used if we need to delete id parameter from endpoint.
//We are checking if our grand child area type`s parent and grand parent are displayed
//We are checking if the temporary names we used in Test case, exist and are shown
pm.test('"Grand Child" area type has a parent and a grand parent so depth 2 and their names should be displayed under its parent tree', () => {

request.description: Please do not delete 'system' and childAreaTypeID variables. Just update the value of them like written in the documentation of first request. If you get 401 code, it means you need to send first request again. #### **You have to update the "childAreaTypeID" from EOCS-T902 directory -> Variables tab because you are working with other area type.** _\*In this request, "child" area type is used._ You can get child area type id from the system. Open area type in detail view and copy the ID of it from the browser URL then paste it as explained just above. #### **You have to update the variables\` names of "parentName" and "grandparentName" from the system because you are working with other types.** #### _**Child Area type should have a parent and this parent also should have a parent.**_

exec: //This test can be still used if we need to delete id parameter from endpoint.

pm.test("The area type 'GRAND CHILD' has two parents(parent and grand parent) but since we are filtering with depth 1 only its parent should be displayed in parent tree of it (not the grand parent)", function () {

request.description: Please do not delete 'system' and parentAreaTypeID variables. Just update the value of them like written in the documentation of first request. If you get 401 code, it means you need to send first request again. #### **You have to update the "parentAreaTypeID" from EOCS-T902 directory -> Variables tab because you are working with other area type.** You can get parent area type id from the system. Open this area type in detail view and copy the ID of it from the browser URL then paste it as explained just above. #### **You have to update the variable\`s name of "parentName" from the system because you are working with other type.** #### _**parent Area type should have a parent (grandParent name in 1st request) and a child (child area name in 1st request).**_

exec: //This test can be still used if we need to delete id parameter from endpoint.

pm.test("The area type 'GRAND CHILD' has two parents but since we are filtering with depth 0, no parents should be displayed in parent tree of it. Every area type should be displayed as separately.", function () {

request.description: Please do not delete 'system' and grandparentAreaTypeID variables. Just update the value of them like written in the documentation of first request. If you get 401 code, it means you need to send first request again. #### **You have to update the "grandparentAreaTypeID" from EOCS-T902 directory -> Variables tab because you are working with other area type.** You can get grand parent area type id from the system. Open this area type in detail view and copy the ID of it from the browser URL then paste it as explained just above. #### **You have to use null for the name of "parentName" because grand parent area type should not have any parent.**
